results.title: The Rise of Catherine the Great [DVD]
results.creator_credit: London Film Productions, Korda-Toeplitz Productions, Alexander Korda, Ludovico Toeplitz and Paul Czinner
results.brief_description: This biographical drama loosely based on historical facts is set in mid-18th century Russia during the reign of the somewhat domineering and determined Empress Elisabeth (played by the wonderful Dame Flora Robson) who in her waning years sets out to arrange a marriage between her nephew and heir to the throne, Grand Duke Peter (Douglas Fairbanks Jnr) and a young German princess named Catherine (Elizabeth Bergner). It is not long, however, before Catherine discovers that her dearly betrothed is both unfaithful and madly insane and yet for all this, she remains devoted and true to him. But with the death of Empress Elisabeth, and Peter’s ascension to the throne, life becomes more unpredictable and precarious for Catherine as Peter’s mental health and behaviour becomes more unstable. Circumstances take control and eventually Catherine is forced to assume power. This is an interesting piece of filming for its time and the quality acting and lavish sets certainly add to its depth. Cast also includes Gerald Du Maurier, Irene Vanbrugh, Diana Napier. NB: Filmed in black and white, the visual quality is quite dark in some scenes and the soundtrack is scratchy but still worth viewing.

results.title: The Right stuff
results.creator_credit: The Ladd Company, Warner Bros Pictures, Irwin Winkler, Robert Chartoff and Philip Kaufman
results.brief_description: Based on Tom Wolfe’s best seller, “The Right Stuff” recounts the development of the American Space programme. Spanning 15 years, the film begins with Chuck Yeager breaking the sound barrier and moves on to concentrate primarily on the original seven Mercury astronauts. The film relates the perils and frustrations of the astronauts, their arduous training and complex personal lives, and the absurd lengths to which they must go to satisfy the public’s demand for real heroes. Cast includes Sam Shepard, Scott Glenn, Ed Harris, Dennis Quaid, Fred Ward and Barbara Hershey.

results.title: The Return of Martin Guerre = Le Retour de Martin Guerre
results.creator_credit: SFP, FR3, Marcel Dassault Productions and Daniel Vigne
results.brief_description: In rural France during the Hundred Years’ War, an unhappy young man (Gerard Depardieu) vanishes from his village leaving his wife and his farm behind. Nine years later he returns a changed person, ostensibly having fought in the war. Though his appearance has altered beyond recognition, his wife (Nathalie Baye), finding him a much better lover and more responsible man than the one that left, accepts him wholeheartedly. Yet the villagers who knew him suspect he is not the man he claims to be, even though he possesses an insider’s knowledge of their lives. Matters come to a head when charges of deception are laid against him and Guerre is forced to defend his identity or face a death sentence. The ensuing court case of raises questions about the nature of identity, memory, perception, and how the passage of time can blur all three. This film was remade in Hollywood under the title “Sommersby” (1993) (also held in the collection). In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Return of Frank James
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Darryl F. Zanuck and Fritz Lang
results.brief_description: In this exploration of justice and revenge inspired by brotherly love, Henry Fonda reprises his role as Jesse James’ brother, Frank, in Fritz Lang’s sequel to ‘Jesse James’. The film is notable for the screen debut of Gene Tierney, as well as being Lang’s first western and his first film in colour. After his brother, Jesse, is shot and killed by the Ford brothers, Frank takes the law into his own hands when the brothers are pardoned. Franks journey alienates him from family and friends, as well as endangering the lives of those close to him. He has only two people to help his lonely and determined plight, teenage friend Clem (Jackie Cooper), and a newspaper owner’s beautiful daughter (Gene Tierney). Cast includes Henry Fonda, Gene Tierney, Jackie Cooper, Henry Hull and John Carradine.

Animated.

results.title: The Remains of the day
results.creator_credit: Columbia, Merchant Ivory Productions, Ismail Merchant, Mike Nichols, John Calley and James Ivory
results.brief_description: Kazuo Ishiguro’s novel is lovingly brought to the screen in this lavish and finely crafted study of English class relations. Anthony Hopkins, in a stunning Academy Award nominated performance, is a butler who has been a gentleman’s gentleman: propriety and service are everything. Even his master’s sympathies for the emerging Nazi Party in Germany do not affect his work. However, on looking back at his life he decides that he was mistaken to choose his work over his emotional attachment to the only woman he has loved (Emma Thompson). Slipping back and forth from the late 1950s to the late 1930s, “Remains of the Day” is both an affecting romance and a sharp and sometimes very sad, very touching examination of how the British class system trapped people into a betrayal of their individual aspirations. It is also a study of how the emerging politics of the Cold War were to finally irrevocably alter those class relations, as America rather than Europe was to dominate as a world power. Co-starring Christopher Reeve and James Fox.

results.title: The Red violin = Le Violon rouge = Violino rosso, Il
results.creator_credit: Red Violin Productions, Sidecar Films and TV, Mikado Film Srl (Rome), Niv Fichman and Francois Girard
results.brief_description: A five part tale which tells the life story of an exquisite 300 year old violin. The film begins with the loving creation of the instrument in 17th century in Italy by a master craftsman for his unborn child. However, upon the death of the baby the instrument maker curses the violin by adding a secret ingredient to the varnish. The central focus is at an auction house in Montreal where the legendary violin is for sale and the bidding is fierce. The focus of the film is not so much the violin’s future, but its affect on the five lives of those who played it over the years, as we are drawn back into each of their worlds. Coveted by child prodigies, virtuosos and gypsies, the instrument is a poisoned chalice with most of the people who play it meeting a tragic and untimely end. This ambitious film is shot in Cremona, Vienna, Oxford, Shanghai and Montreal, with dialogue in French, English, Italian, Spanish and Mandarin. An Academy Award winning musical soundtrack composed by John Corigliano reminds us of the beauty of the violin as the viewer follows its travels across time and space. Written by Don McKellar and Francois Girard.

results.title: The Red shoes [DVD]
results.creator_credit: GFD, Archers Film Productions, Michael Powell and Emeric Pressburger
results.brief_description: A superb stylised fairy tale and perennial favourite of balletomanes. A young ballerina is torn between two creative, possessive men, one a struggling composer, the other an autocratic dance impresario. Still revered as the greatest dance film ever made and a landmark film for its integration of dance in storytelling. With choreography by Robert Helpmann, it was originally intended to star Merle Oberon but features the dazzling debut of Scottish-born Moira Shearer and Marius Goring as the romantic lead. She partners Robert Helpmann in a famous 14 minute ballet based on a Hans Christian Anderson fairytale about a magical pair of shoes. This film has inspired generations of aspiring dancers and will continue to do so. (Awards: Winner of Academy Award for Music).

results.title: The Red desert = Il deserto rosso
results.brief_description: Guiliana (Monica Vitti) struggles to fit back into her life after suffering from a mental breakdown. Her husband doesn’t seem to be able to help her yet she is drawn to Corrado Zeller (Richard Harris). “Il deserto rosso” is Antonioni’s first colour film and he uses colour, landscape and sound masterfully to reflect Guiliana’s state of mind. Ravenna is transformed into an industrial landscape yet Antonioni manages to make it beautiful by framing objects so that they appear as abstract paintings. Monica Vitti is rivetting as the fragile Guiliana. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: The Real glory
results.brief_description: Set in 1906, a lonely outpost of American soldiers is left in Manila to train the Philippine Constabulary in the ways of war. They must prevent further uprisings from opposing tribes hidden in the jungle, or face continued oppression. An idealistic Doctor (Gary Cooper) clashes with the captain in charge (and the father of the woman he has fallen in love with), on how the native Moro’s can best be trained, and whether they should defend the outpost or take the battle to the jungle. As the water supply is sabotaged by the jungle tribe, the soldiers and Moros reliant on the precious water face a natural disaster as devastating as the tribal violence, cholera. Based on the novel by Charles L. Clifford. Cast includes Andrea Leeds, David Niven and Reginald Owen.
